citation.article-title: Clostridium halophilium sp. nov. and Clostridium litorale sp. nov., an obligate halophilic and a marine species degrading betaine in the Stickland reaction.

p.s: Description of Clostridium halophilum sp. nov.
Clostridium halophilum (ha.lo'phi.lum, hals, halos Gr. n. salt; philein Gr. v. loving, halophilum M.L. adj. saltloving)

Rod-shaped cells, 0.8-1.0 μm x 2.5 x 7.0 μm in size, with straight ends; motile, spherical spores (1.2 μm) formed terminally in aging cultures, preferentially after growth on sugars; gram-reaction positive; gram-positive cell wall with surface-layer.
Strictly anaerobic chemoorganotroph: D-cellobiose, dulcitol, D-fructose, D-glucose, inulin, D-mannitol, D-mannose, D-ribose, salicin and D-sorbitol are fermented under acidification.

Betaine is as oxidant in the Stickland reaction reductively cleaved into trimethylamine and acetate with hydrogen, glycine, L-alanine, L-leucine, L-isoleucine, L-valine, L-phenylalanine or L-histidine.
Produces propionate from threonine and grows on pyruvate.
In complex standard media gas, including hydrogen, is produced; acetate and ethanol are the major fermentation products.
Hydrogen sulfide, indole and ammonia are formed.
Growth is stimulated by Tween 80.
It is positive for esculin hydrolysis, and there is reduction of neutral red and resazurin.
It is catalase and oxidase negative.
Lipase, lecithinase or urease is not produced.
Meat and milk are not digested.
Gelatin and starch are not hydrolyzed and nitrate, sulfate, thiosulfate or sulfite are not reduced.
Resistant against chloramphenicol (12 μg/ml)
Growth requires addition of complex nutrients.
Temperature range. 18°C-49°C; optimum growth at 41°C.
pH Range. 6.0-8.0; optimum growth at 7.4; obligately halophilic, 1.5% NaCl required; optimum growth at 6.0% NaCl, growth not inhibited by 10.0% NaCl.
DNA base ratio. 26.9% G+ C (thermal denaturation).
Habitats.
Anoxic hypersaline sediments of the Maledive Islands and Solar Lake, Egypt, as well as marine sediments of the North Sea, Germany.
Type strain.
Strain M1, DSM 5387, deposited in Deutsche Sammlung yon Mikroorganismen und Zellkulturen, Braunschweig, FRG.
